metadata.title: CVE-2024-27432 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:ethernet: mtk_eth_soc: fix PPE hanging issue A patch to resolve an issuewas found in MediaTek's GPL-licensed SDK: In the mtk_ppe_stop() function,the PPE scan mode is not disabled before disabling the PPE. This canpotentially lead to a hang during the process of disabling the PPE. Withoutthis patch, the PPE may experience a hang during the reboot test.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
